English: Kolguyev, 1987
They told me I would find you here. What are you thinking about, Vladimir?
I stand at the very spot where comrade Livanokh planned the fall of the west.
This is where he devised his plan. Years of planning, careful considerations, preparations and hope.
His dream od putting down the capitalist sham and bring all the guilty to justice. Dream he never lived to see.

These walls could tell stories. If only I could see through them and find comrade Livanokh at his desk, preparing. At this balcony, considering his next steps. His final moments in this villa, dying from a wound inflicted by an American bullet.
If only, Zinovy. It is up to us to finish what he started. Do you bring news?
I do.
Then let us talk.
I had another disagreement with Frolov. He does not believe we are on the right path anymore.
What changed?
His wife died two years ago and he has not been himself ever since. He believes God punished him for his past and took her away.
He regrets taking part in the first war. Loyalty is still deeply rooted in him, but it's shaken. I can't be certain of him anymore.
Then we should be ready to find a suitable alternative. Look around for some loyal and amibitous recruits. Frolov still prefers to command from the front, doesn't he?
Indeed.
If it comes down to it, we could arrange an accident. Nothing can come between us and Malden.
Of course. On another note, the people from Europe perform really well, actually. Chernikov does what he's told without question, Kaplinsky has a sharp mind and is loyal to me personally...
That infamous tale of the convoy ambush in Afghanistan. I heard that one too many times.
They were about to drown him in those marshes if I haven't arrived. I love the story myself.
Back to the topic at hand, Syomin is the newest. I am not yet completely sure, but given what we know...
Observe him, but he shouldn't be an issue. Good, Zinovy, we are almost ready.
You keep saying that. For years now, actually.
Patience is a virtue. This time, I truly mean it. I believe we can start next year. There is one remaining topic - Lemontov.
Is he not in prison?
A possibilty presented itself to get him out.
What? How?
KGB recently captured western spies in Moscow. They were not able to get anything useful out of them, but the US is keen on getting them back.
They are willing to exchange prisoners - Lemontov for their return.
Are you serious? Do agree?
I can't afford not to agree. Comrade Livanokh's right hand and a military genius - without him we have a chance to win, with him I am certain of victory.
Do you not believe me to pull my weight?
Of course, Zinovy, but this is Lemontov we speak of. Forget your pride for once for the good of the plan.
It seems I am to be replaced and I don't like it.
Don't be foolish. I don't trust Lemontov. He's been away for a long time and he spent all that with the enemy. I'm not about to hand him over the command of our forces.
No, rather we test him and use his abilities to our advantage - we don't have to involve him in our plans until much, much later.
That I can agree with, Vladimir. Although I still maintain we do not need him...
I already made the choice, the exchange could happen in a few months time. I will return on that day to meet him personally.
In the meantime, follow the plan. We are on our way to changing the world forever.
